Refactor to v4, simplified, type-safe API (#33)

* Refactor to v4, simplified, type-safe API

* Update CI/CD to use correct PHP/PHPUnit versions

* Enable xdebug in GitHub action phpunit runner

* Specify coverage env variable for GitHub runner

* Fix code linting, more updates to GitHub actions

* Use different PHP actions

* Add static analysis to CI

Helper package to ease testing with PHPUnit.

commits.message: Replace loop in setUp()
Trait magic to support PHPUnit 6, 7, and 8

Also declare trait properties in AsyncTestCase

Stops undefined warnings in PhpStorm.
Improve docs
Add @internal annotations to internal traits
Fix code style

Add test case throwing Error

Related to #6.
Allow travis failure on 7.4
Handle exceptions from nested loops

Use test assertion for minimum runtime

Avoids error that the test did not perform any assertions.
Quite CS fixer
Fail test if returned promise or coroutine does not resolve
Dump info if TracingDriver is used
Update README
PHPUnit 9 support (#11)
Provide information where timeout is reached in AsyncTestCase (#14)
Add setUpAsync() and tearDownAsync() (#17)
Update for Amp v3 and ext-fiber
Add method to ignore enabled loop watchers
Clear loop before and after each test

issue.title: Allow assertThrows methods to take a custom assertion message
issue.body: Currently the `ThrowableAssert::assertThrows` methods do not expose a way to customize the assertion message displayed in case of failure. It is always the message we derive from the method invoked. It would be beneficial if users could provide their own custom assertion message. This should be implemented after #1 as implementing a custom constraint will change the way `PHPUnit\Framework\Assert` is used withing `ThrowableAssert`.

issue.title: Implement custom PHPUnit Constraint
issue.body:
Currently the `ThrowableAssert::assertThrows*` methods are utilizing a try/catch/finally block and then `PHPUnit\Framework\Assert` methods are used. For example, `Assert::assertNotNull` is used in the finally block of `assertThrows` to check that an  exception is thrown. Instead of using this method of checking for thrown exceptions we should implement a custom `PHPUnit\Framework\Constraint\Constraint`. This would allow several benefits including:

- Removes a minimal amount of code duplication in `ThrowableAssert`.
- Reduces the total amount of asserts when calling an `assertThrows*` method to 1 instead of a variable amount per method.
- Paves the way for using other PHPUnit features, like custom assertions messages and implementing `assertNotThrows`.
- Is a more technically correct implementation using PHPUnit's available API.
